author: travelandtourworld.com
title: UK issues travel warning for Kurdistan region - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
UK issues travel warning for Kurdistan region Published on : Monday, October 12, 2015
The United Kingdom has advised its citizens against all but essential travel to the Kurdistan region, citing protests in Suliamani province that the Foreign and Commonwealth Office (FCO) described as violent.
“Demonstrations involving violence are taking place in the Sulaimaniya province and may spread. You should avoid political gatherings and large crowds. Observe instructions given by the local security authorities,” the FCO posted on its official website on Sunday.
The FCO advised against all travel to Kirkuk province, a disputed area in which the capital city of is held by Kurdish forces, as well as the Iraqi provinces of Anbar, Mosul, Salahadin, and Diyala.
“The security situation throughout Iraq remains uncertain, and could deteriorate quickly. You should monitor media reporting and make sure you have robust contingency plans in place,” the FCO said.
“There is a high threat of terrorism including kidnapping across Iraq,” it concluded.
